title: A theory of desirable things. (arXiv:2302.07412v3 [cs.AI] UPDATED)
abstract: Inspired by the theory of desirable gambles that is used to model uncertainty in the field of imprecise probabilities, I present a theory of desirable things. Its aim is to model a subject's beliefs about which things are desirable. What the things are is not important, nor is what it means for them to be desirable. It can be applied to gambles, calling them desirable if a subject accepts them, but it can just as well be applied to pizzas, calling them desirable if my friend Arthur likes to eat them. Other useful examples of things one might apply this theory to are propositions, horse lotteries, or preferences between any of the above. Regardless of the particular things that are considered, inference rules are imposed by means of an abstract closure operator, and models that adhere to these rules are called coherent. translated_title: 一种关于“理想事物”的理论
translated_abstract: 在不确定性概率领域中使用“理想赌博”的理论作为启发，我提出了一种关于“理想事物”的理论。它的目的是建模一个主体对哪些事物是理想的信念。事物本身的属性并不重要，也不重要它们被定义为理想的意义。它可以应用于赌博，如果一个主体接受它们，则称它们为理想赌博，但同样也可以应用于披萨，如果我的朋友阿瑟喜欢吃它们，则称它们为理想披萨。其他有用的例子包括命题、马彩票或任何上述事物之间的偏好。通过抽象的闭合算子来施加推理规则，并称遵循这些规则的模型为连贯的。我考虑了两种类型的模型，每种模型都能捕捉到主体对哪些事物是理想的信念：一种是理想事物的集合模型，一种是理想集合的集合模型。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种关于“理想事物”的理论，利用抽象的闭合算子施加推理规则来捕捉人对哪些事物或概念是理想的信念。
en_tdlr: The paper proposes a theory of desirable things, using an abstract closure operator to impose inference rules and capture a subject's belief about which things are desirable, which can be applied to various things including gambles, pizzas, propositions, and preferences.
